page.title: 17Education 1: West Eastbourne
page.content: The information on Education is based on an interview with Mr Rex Lord, formerly joint headmaster of St. Bede's school. There are several private schools in this area. These include Eastbourne College, St.Bede's, St.Andrew's, Moira House and Beresford House. Most of these schools dated from the 1890s when the Duke of Devonshire owned the land. Large houses were built for large families and land was also available for private schools. Many families went abroad to different parts of the empire, especially to India. Problems of climate meant that children needed to be educated at home. Money was in plentiful supply and Eastbourne with its fine sea front and the Downs was ideal for parents who wanted to visit their children.
